property.name: http.robots.agents
property.description: The agent strings we'll look for in robots.txt files, comma-separated, in decreasing order of precedence. You should put the value of http.agent.name as the first agent name, and keep the default * at the end of the list. E.g.: BlurflDev,Blurfl,*

property.name: http.agent.version
property.description: A version string to advertise in the User-Agent header.

property.name: http.timeout
property.description: The default network timeout, in milliseconds.

property.name: http.redirect.max
property.description: The maximum number of redirects the fetcher will follow when trying to fetch a page. If set to negative or 0, fetcher won't immediately follow redirected URLs, instead it will record them for later fetching.

property.name: parser.character.encoding.default
property.description: The character encoding to fall back to when no other information is available

property.name: db.parsemeta.to.crawldb
property.description: Comma-separated list of parse metadata keys to transfer to the crawldb (NUTCH-779). Assuming for instance that the languageidentifier plugin is enabled, setting the value to 'lang' will copy both the key 'lang' and its value to the corresponding entry in the crawldb.

property.name: http.content.limit
property.description: The length limit for downloaded content using the http:// protocol, in bytes. If this value is nonnegative (>=0), content longer than it will be truncated; otherwise, no truncation at all. Do not confuse this setting with the file.content.limit setting.

property.name: http.accept.language
property.description: Value of theAccept-Language request header field. This allows selecting non-Englishlanguage as default one to retrieve. It is a useful setting for search enginesbuild for certain national group.

property.name: fetcher.server.delay
property.description: The number of seconds the fetcher will delay between successive requests to the same server.

property.name: fetcher.threads.per.host
property.description: This number is the maximum number of threads that should be allowed to access a host at one time.
